post.summary: Generate JWT token with optional custom expiration time
Generate JWT token for currently authenticated user (cookie-based)
Refresh access token using refresh token
Revoke all refresh tokens for the current user
Generate a one-time use QR code token for authenticated user
post.description:
This endpoint generates a secure one-time use token that can be encoded in a QR code.
The token expires after 2 minutes and can only be used once.
The authenticated user on one device can scan this QR code on another device to log in without entering credentials.

post.summary: Login using a one-time QR code token
post.description:
This endpoint consumes a one-time use token (from QR code scan) and logs the user in.
The token is validated and then marked as consumed. If successful, returns authentication tokens.

enableMaintenanceMode.description:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the entire site is in maintenance mode.
If true, non-admin users should be redirected to a maintenance page.

maintenanceModeMessage.description: Gets or sets the message to display to users when the site is in maintenance mode.
maintenanceModeMessage.default: The site is currently down for maintenance. Please check back later.

defaultPageSize.description: Gets or sets the default number of items to display per page in paginated lists.

maxUploadFileSizeMb.description: Gets or sets the maximum allowed file size for user uploads, in megabytes (MB).

backgroundTaskCronExpression.description:
Gets or sets the CRON expression that defines the schedule for a recurring background job.
Example: "0 2 * * *" for 2:00 AM daily.

systemEmail.description: Gets or sets the email address used by the system for sending notifications, alerts, and other automated emails.

mailServer.description:
Gets or sets the SMTP server address used for sending emails.
Format: "smtp.server.com"

mailServerPort.description: Gets or sets the port number for the SMTP server.

smtpUsername.description:
Gets or sets the SMTP username for email authentication.
Usually the same as SystemEmail but can be different for some providers.

smtpPassword.description:
Gets or sets the SMTP password for email authentication.
Store app-specific passwords for providers like Gmail, Outlook, etc.

smtpEnableSsl.description: Gets or sets whether to use SSL/TLS encryption for SMTP connections.

sessionTimeoutMinutes.description: Gets or sets the duration in minutes before an inactive user's session expires.

maxFailedLoginAttempts.description: Gets or sets the maximum number of failed login attempts before an account is locked.

accountLockoutMinutes.description: Gets or sets the duration in minutes that an account remains locked after too many failed login attempts.

minimumPasswordLength.description: Gets or sets the minimum required character length for user passwords.

allowedIpRangesForAdminAccess.description:
Gets or sets a comma-separated list of Ip addresses or CIDR blocks allowed to access admin areas.
An empty or null string means access is not restricted by Ip.

enableOnlinePayments.description:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether online payment processing is enabled.
This can be used as a "kill switch" for the payment system.

enableNewUserRegistration.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether new users can register for an account.

enablePushNotifications.description:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the system should send push notifications.
Acts as a master "kill switch" for all push notifications.

logLevel.description:
Gets or sets the desired logging level (e.g., "Information", "Debug", "Warning", "Error").
This should map to a LogLevel enum in your logging system.

healthAlertsEmail.description: Gets or sets the email address where critical system health alerts are sent.

apiServiceEndpointUrl.description: Gets or sets the base endpoint URL for a primary external API dependency.

apiServiceTimeoutSeconds.description: Gets or sets the timeout in seconds when calling the primary external API.

major.description: Gets the Major version component. Incremented for incompatible API changes.

minor.description: Gets the Minor version component. Incremented for functionality added in a backwards-compatible manner.

patch.description: Gets the Patch version component. Incremented for backwards-compatible bug fixes.

build.description:
Gets the optional Build version component. Often used for CI build numbers or revisions.
Returns null if no build number was specified.

preReleaseTag.description:
Gets the optional Pre-release tag (e.g., "alpha", "beta", "rc.1").
Returns null or empty if this is a stable release.

originalString.description: Gets the original string that this version was parsed from, if available.

FirmwareVersionEntity.description:
Represents a firmware version, typically following Major.Minor.Patch pattern,
potentially including a Build number and/or a PreRelease tag.
Provides functionality for parsing, comparison, string representation, and generation.
